By Gracie Daw

Action on 21, 22, 23, 27, 28 February and 1 and 2 March will not go ahead

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

Three rule-breaking candidates go unpunished

Mike Anstey, Kallum Taylor, and Jason Brandwood have all had complaints filed against them for rule-breaking, with Anstey violating a total of five election rules

The Nouse Elections Survey 2013

Let us know how you'll vote, and we'll give you a results prediction!

Head of English criticises coalition curriculum

"York English students are among the best in the country, and in general they are very well prepared for university study"

Turnout increase of 30 per cent over last year

YUSU data shows a 30 per cent increase on last year in votes cast for sabbatical officer positions

As it happened: Candidate Interview Night

Get all the live action and commentary on the part-time officer candidates as they battle it out in this year's hustings

Campaign posters vandalised

At least eight YUSU elections candidates have fallen victim to vandalism of campaign posters across campus

As it happened: YUSU Elections Sabbs Debate

Nouse reports live from the YUSU Elections Sabbs Debate in V/045

York ranks 4th in Sexual Health Report

The University of York has been ranked fourth against a table of Britain's leading Universities in a recent sexual health report

Election candidate withdrawals rise to five

Five candidates have chosen to withdraw from the 2013 YUSU elections

PantSoc could owe children's charity PS240

PantSoc could owe as much as PS240 to Great Ormond Street Children's Hospital

YUSU called to stop stocking 'offensive publications'

Pornographic magazines and <em>The Sun</em> are among publications which YUSU is being called upon to stop stocking in YourShop

Article Retracted

Applications to York increase by 8.5%

Applications to the University are up by 8.5 per cent for home students and 5 per cent for overseas students.

In Pictures: RAG Parade

A selection of pictures from this year's RAG Parade which raised a total of PS2188 on Saturday's Parade. James College raised the most money with PS488.09.

Students shun approved housing list

A YUSU survey has revealed that half of York students used the University's approved housing list when searching for off-campus accommodation while 13.2 per cent had not heard of the list at all.

Women's Committee posters defaced

Posters put up around the University by the Women's Committee as part of the Zero Tolerance campaign have been defaced. One poster placed in the men's toilets in D Bar which originally read "No means No" was changed to read "No means Now".

Petition for refugees to pay home fees

The Student Action for Refugees (STAR) society have launched a petition campaigning for refugees and asylum seekers studying in the UK to pay the same fees as home students.

YUSU President proposes a fourth loan for medics

Kallum Taylor, YUSU President, is to propose a motion to the NUS Conference in April with the aim of improving and increasing the availability of funding including maintenance loans for Medical, Midwifery and Nursing students.

Society ratification process overhauled

YUSU have agreed to change how societies are approved at the application stage after the recent Palestinian Solidarity Society debacle.

'Poor' Health Centre waiting times

Results of the University Health Centre survey have revealed an increase in students dissatisfaction with waiting times.

New 'LIPS' Society

Following the successful launch on February 1 attended by over 50 people, newly formed organisation Ladies in Politics (LIPS) has spoken to Nouse about their plans for the future.

YUSU unaccountable for decisions since 2011

Demo 2012, Staff Contracts: no assembly mandate under minimum attendance rules. Kallum Taylor, YUSU President and the other sabbatical officers cannot not be held accountable for failure to act on many assembly motions that a majority of students present voted in favour of.

University on track to miss carbon targets

Recent figures obtained by Nouse have revealed the University is set to miss its long term carbon emissions target. It has since admitted this to be a "challenging target".

University Welfare "run off their feet"

The University of York Open Door Welfare service has come under criticism from students and the Student Union for failing to accommodate the number of students seeking support.

One in nine postgraduates don't finish course

University data has revealed that as many as 1 in 9 postgraduate students leave their courses incomplete. 35 per cent of postgraduate students in the Physics department and 32 per cent of Chemistry postgraduates failed to complete their course last academic year.

Candidates Announced for YUSU Elections

The candidates for the YUSU Elections have been announced

Subsidiary of RAG week sponsor in water pollution conviction

Controversy has arisen over RAG week sponsors Shell, after a court found its daughter company guilty of causing pollution

YUSU officers "disappointed" at MP's opposition to gay marriage

Julian Sturdy MP has defended his decision to vote against yesterday's same sex marriage bill against criticism from YUSU officers

Organisers apologise for 'Lesser Nation' social

"It's a shame that students in positions of responsibility on campus think they can get away with this kind of bigotry"

In Pictures: RAG Balloon Launch

Pink and turquoise balloons were released over campus to herald the start of RAG Week 2013

Mike Anstey, Kallum Taylor, and Jason Brandwood have all had complaints filed against them for rule-breaking, with Anstey violating a total of five election rules
